transcripts.text: Hello, everyone.  I'm Farland Webster-Dreen with MRCTV, and I am out here in Baltimore, Maryland, which is a sanctuary city.  We're here to talk to American citizens about sanctuary cities and see if they'll put their money where their mouth is and how some of these illegal immigrants.  Do you support sanctuary cities?
I do.  I support it because these people need a place to go.
We have a lot of immigrants here already.  And to me, I think they help the city.
They're just trying to start their lives over again from where they came from.
You know, by getting jobs, doing jobs that... Americans wouldn't normally do.
There is obviously a reason that they are coming here for the opportunities, for potential safety.
I just don't agree with a city being a sanctuary city.
And just to send them back and turn their backs on them, I think it's a little inhumane.
And I don't think you should be able to do something wrong and be protected by a city.

Recently Trump sent out a tweet basically expressing his frustration over Democrats not not working with him on border security and was saying that he was considering sending illegal immigrants to sanctuary cities only.  Right, right.  What are your thoughts on that?
I am all for Trump's proposal.  Because then, maybe then, it will get all Americans to understand the enormity of the issue.
I mean, I think it would be illegal.
You cannot just bring in people to the country without knowing who's coming and why they're coming.
This whole narrative on legal immigration right now is a fear tactic.  It's something that's playing to Trump's base.

You have people who do come here through the legal process, or they come here legally.  Sure.  And you have the people who are... getting past the process of coming illegally.  it is a is an added a service to people who are doing it the right way.
i i i do.  i. i believe that uh... i know it's.  the people become over-the-counter legally for years and they shouldn't come over illegally.
they need to come in legally.
yeah i agree with that.  however This is a situation that's been going on for a long time.

But when they're already here, you should at least give them the opportunity to become legal other than just sending them back or sending them to one of the camps that they've been sending people to so far.

They're coming in illegally and like my ancestors came in here and waited and came here legally.  And I have other relatives that have waited to come here legally.  So the people coming in here illegally frustrates me.
So it's time to do something about it then.
It is.  I mean, there's always been time to do something about it.  However, at this point, it's not about doing something about it.  It's about creating, you know...

fear among American people.  You're basically saying that we should help take care of these people.  We should.  And a lot of people, like I've noticed just in life in general, don't practice what they preach.  I understand that.  Like you personally, would you be willing to help take care of them?  I would absolutely support them.  Of course.  Like money and everything?  Of course, of course.  Yeah.  In what kind of ways?
Well, there's many ways.  Trying to find some place from the stage jobs, especially the kids.  You know, feed the kids, give the kids clothing and stuff.
As a person myself, I give to charities.  I try to do good to other people as they do well to me.
Would you personally be willing to allow them to stay in your home?
No, because I'm in the senior building.
I don't know.  I don't know.  I mean, it would be just like letting a regular United States citizen come in and live in my house.  What's the difference?  They're all human beings.
They don't have one bedroom.
You can share the bedroom.  No, no, no.  Why not?
I can't share the bedroom.
It would be hard for me, too, because I have two small children, seven and ten.  If it was just myself personally, as a single person, I wouldn't be up for it.  I would probably give somebody a shot.
No doubt.  I'm assuming you would not be willing to allow an illegal immigrant to live in your home.
No way.
No way.  Neither would I. Right across the street?
Yeah.  Okay.
Well, I can let the illegal immigrants know.  No!
I don't care.  You can send them.  They can come and visit during the day, but they can't stay.
So are you going to bring some illegal immigrants in your home?
No.  Mainly because I'm just not trusting of humans in general.
Okay.
But I will give them the benefit of the doubt.
And then bring him in?  After you give him the benefit or no?
You know how I'm wording this.
You know how I'm wording this.
No, I hear you.  So you don't look at it as a hypocrisy at all?
Like what you're saying?  No.
